tips.title: Accept Suggestions with Tab
tips.description: Press Tab to accept a full inline suggestion from GitHub Copilot. This is the primary way to incorporate Copilot's code completions into your work.

tips.title: Cycle Through Suggestions
tips.description: Use Alt+] (or Option+]) to see the next suggestion and Alt+[ (or Option+[) to see the previous suggestion when Copilot offers multiple completions.

tips.title: Accept Word by Word
tips.description: Press Ctrl+Right Arrow (or Cmd+Right Arrow on Mac) to accept a suggestion word by word, giving you more granular control over what code you incorporate.

tips.title: Dismiss Suggestions with Escape
tips.description: Press Escape to dismiss the current suggestion if it's not what you need. Copilot will offer new suggestions as you continue typing.

tips.title: Open Copilot Chat with Keyboard
tips.description: Press Ctrl+Alt+I (or Cmd+Alt+I on Mac) in VS Code to quickly open the Copilot Chat panel and start a conversation about your code.

tips.title: Use Inline Chat for Quick Edits
tips.description: Press Ctrl+I (or Cmd+I on Mac) to open inline chat directly in your editor. This is perfect for quick code modifications without leaving your current context.

tips.title: Write Descriptive Comments First
tips.description: Write a clear comment describing what you want to accomplish before writing code. Copilot uses these comments as context to generate more accurate suggestions.

tips.title: Use @workspace for Project Context
tips.description: In Copilot Chat, use @workspace to ask questions about your entire codebase. Copilot will search and analyze relevant files to provide context-aware answers.

tips.title: Reference Files with #file
tips.description: Use #file:filename in Copilot Chat to explicitly include a specific file as context for your question or request.

tips.title: Use /explain to Understand Code
tips.description: Select code and use /explain in Copilot Chat to get a detailed explanation of what the code does. Great for understanding unfamiliar codebases.

tips.title: Fix Code with /fix
tips.description: Select problematic code and use /fix in Copilot Chat to get suggestions for fixing bugs, errors, or improving code quality.

tips.title: Generate Tests with /tests
tips.description: Use /tests in Copilot Chat to automatically generate unit tests for your selected code. Copilot will create tests appropriate for your testing framework.

tips.title: Provide Examples in Your Prompts
tips.description: Include examples of the input/output you expect when asking Copilot to generate code. Examples help Copilot understand your exact requirements.

tips.title: Keep Related Files Open
tips.description: Keep relevant files open in your editor tabs. Copilot uses open files as additional context to provide more accurate and consistent suggestions.

tips.title: Use Meaningful Variable Names
tips.description: Use descriptive variable and function names. Copilot analyzes naming patterns to understand your intent and generate more relevant code.

tips.title: Break Down Complex Tasks
tips.description: Break complex problems into smaller, well-defined steps. Ask Copilot to help with each step individually for better results.

tips.title: Use @terminal for CLI Help
tips.description: Use @terminal in Copilot Chat to get help with command-line operations, shell scripts, and terminal commands specific to your environment.

tips.title: Generate Documentation with /doc
tips.description: Select a function or class and use /doc to generate documentation comments. Copilot will create appropriate JSDoc, docstrings, or other format documentation.

tips.title: Specify Language and Framework
tips.description: When asking Copilot for help, specify the programming language and framework you're using for more targeted and accurate suggestions.

tips.title: Use #selection for Current Selection
tips.description: Reference #selection in Copilot Chat to explicitly include your currently selected code as context for your question.

tips.title: Review and Validate Suggestions
tips.description: Always review Copilot suggestions before accepting them. Verify the code is correct, secure, and follows your project's coding standards.

tips.title: Iterate on Your Prompts
tips.description: If Copilot's first response isn't quite right, refine your prompt with more specific details or constraints. Good prompts often require iteration.

tips.title: Use Smart Actions in Editor
tips.description: Right-click on code in VS Code to access Copilot smart actions like 'Explain This', 'Fix This', and 'Generate Docs' directly from the context menu.

tips.title: Leverage Copilot for Refactoring
tips.description: Ask Copilot Chat to refactor code for better readability, performance, or to follow specific design patterns. Describe the refactoring goals clearly.

tips.title: Use @vscode for Editor Questions
tips.description: Use @vscode in Copilot Chat to ask questions about VS Code features, settings, extensions, and how to accomplish tasks in the editor.

tips.title: Trigger Suggestions Manually
tips.description: Press Ctrl+Space (or Cmd+Space on Mac) to manually trigger Copilot suggestions when they don't appear automatically.

tips.title: Use Function Signatures as Context
tips.description: Write the function signature (name, parameters, return type) first. Copilot will use this information to generate an appropriate implementation.

tips.title: Include Edge Cases in Comments
tips.description: Mention edge cases and error handling requirements in your comments. Copilot will incorporate these considerations into the generated code.

tips.title: Use Copilot in Pull Request Reviews
tips.description: GitHub Copilot can help review pull requests on GitHub.com, providing summaries and suggesting improvements to code changes.

tips.title: Start New Chat for New Topics
tips.description: Start a new chat conversation when switching to a different topic or task. This prevents context from previous conversations from affecting new responses.

tips.title: Use #codebase for Broad Searches
tips.description: Use #codebase in Copilot Chat to search across your entire codebase when you need to find patterns, implementations, or understand project-wide conventions.

tips.title: Specify Constraints in Prompts
tips.description: Include constraints like time complexity, memory usage, or specific libraries to use. Clear constraints help Copilot generate code that meets your requirements.

tips.title: Use Copilot CLI for Terminal
tips.description: Install GitHub Copilot CLI to get AI assistance directly in your terminal. Use 'gh copilot suggest' and 'gh copilot explain' for command-line help.

tips.title: Create a .github/copilot-instructions.md
tips.description: Add a copilot-instructions.md file to your repository's .github folder to provide project-specific context and coding guidelines that Copilot will follow.

tips.title: Use Quick Fix for Error Resolution
tips.description: When you see a code error, click the lightbulb icon or press Ctrl+. to see Copilot's Quick Fix suggestions for resolving the issue.
